results.title: Flux
results.brief_description: Director Michaela French uses 2-D animation, over-laying images and sound to create a narrative. A woman narrates over abstracted imagery relating her feelings of loss and grief, coming to terms with the death of a soul-mate in a recent car accident. What emerges is an exploration into grief itself. The narrator not only looks at her separation from her soul-mate, but asks questions about the change of her physical space as a result of their absence.

results.title: Flutter and its prevention
results.brief_description: The significance of “flutter” in aerodynamics and its drastic results, ie aeroplane crash. Ways to prevent flutter and therefore avoid aircraft accidents and loss of life and valuable property.

results.title: Fluteman
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Minyaka is a town in need of miracles and happiness. Desperate for water and ruled by dishonest councillors they cannot even afford a swimming pool. A mysterious stranger, known only as the ‘Fluteman’ promises that he can create rain, for a cost. The councillors, (not believing his promise) agree to the sum of $5,000. The Fluteman creates rain, much the the relief of Minyaka. The councillors refuse to pay the amount promised however and Fluteman, like the Pied Piper of Hamelin, leads the children out of town in retaliation. Only a young school teacher with the assistance of her mute student can locate the children and expose the councillors to the rest of the township.

results.title: Flute, clarinet and bassoon
results.brief_description: Introduces three of the woodwind instruments and illustrates the principle by which each produces a musical sound. How a scale is produced by the opening and closing of holes is demonstrated through diagrams and close-ups of each instrument. The instruments are played separately, in pairs and as a trio.

results.title: Fluoridation
results.brief_description: Informational film made up almost entirely by static animated stills from the US Public Health Service as a plea for all communities to incorporate fluoride into water systems for the sake of the health of our teeth. Briefly explains why fluoride is so condusive to dental health.

results.title: Fluid
results.brief_description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!
results.description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!

results.title: Flubber
results.creator_credit: Les Mayfield, Ricardo Mestres, John Hughes, Great Oaks and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: In this colourful remake of ‘The Absent Minded Professor’ (1961), Robin Williams plays Professor Philip Brainard, a brilliant off the wall inventor with an unfortunate short term memory. Flubber, his latest creation is a green rubber-like substance, which has the capacity to give objects flight. Potentially a gold mine for the professor and his college (which is near bankruptcy), the invention receives the unwelcome attention of Brainard’s spiteful nemesis Wilson Croft (Christopher McDonald), who has his own plans for the gravity-defying matter. The romantic subplot which involves a bizarre love triangle between Brainard, his long suffering fiance Sara (Marcia Gay Harden), and a female robot with a jealous streak called Weebo (Jodi Benson), give the film some surprisingly poignant moments, mainly due to Harden’s tender performance. Music by Danny Elfman and screenplay by John Hughes and Bill Walsh.

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 3.
results.creator_credit: David Pritchard, John Chase, Pam Stockley and Stockley Chase Productions
results.brief_description: Keith Floyd concludes his culinary journey around Australia with visits to the Northern Territory and Queensland. Highlights include his attempt to interest some truckies in a gourmet lunch of chicken, a meal cooked in a pit on a Queensland beach and mud crabs cooked by a rain forest river in the company of an Aboriginal dance troupe.

results.title: Floyd on Oz. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: David Pritchard, Pam Stockley, John Chase and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Floyd travels through locations in Australia, meeting people, seeing different sights and cooking dishes in exotic surroundings. In Central Australia he dines on a silver service table on the Adelaide River. In West Australia he creates a piquant sauce for the wife of Australian millionaire, Alan Bond. In the outback Floyd cooks for the Bishop of The Kimberleys. He eats aboriginal food on a bush tucker tour.
